ygData.subject: RE: RE:warp speed spock
ygData.msgSnippet: That s not too bad, easy to adjust to.  Problem in Q Hills is much worse. Wolves warp from the ridge next to BB all the way to the zone line into Qeynos, which
ygData.messageBody:
That's not too bad, easy to adjust to. Problem in Q Hills is much worse.
Wolves warp from the ridge next to BB all the way to the zone line into
Qeynos, which can be deadly when they run back with Holly and Cros in tow.
Its hard to make sure they are not around when the point they could be near
is out of sight by a country mile for you, but merely a step for the
critters.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: David Knadler [mailto:dknadler@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 26, 1999 11:02 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] RE:warp speed spock
Importance: Low


From: David Knadler <dknadler@...>

Yes... I've noticed this many times while fighting Broon in East Karana. I
usually Chain + Fear him, and he almost always heads to the same spot... on
the road next to the two paladins just to the south (?) of the wooden bridge
to NK. As soon as he hits this particular spot (you can even notice where
it is... where the textures mesh together), he'll immediately warp 200 ft.,
or so, next to the roadsign. As another poster stated, I've grown used to
seeing it, so I usually run ahead of him before he warps.

Desmei Sightblinder
Lvl 30 Bard [Povar]

>
> Kitasi

> > > On Tue, 26 Oct 1999, Greg Gillan wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Has anyone else noticed this strange warping problem
> lately? I had
> > > never
> > > > experienced it before, but it seems since the last
> patch, things have
> > > been
> > > > "warping" out of range all the time. I've noticed this in the
> > Karanas,
> > > > Oasis, and even in Solusek B last night. New bug?
> > >
> > > I noticed a lot of people playing last night (1600+ on more
> > > than half the servers). Ping times and PL were fine, but
> > > /tells took up to 10 seconds to get through. Most network
> > > systems are designed to dynamically respond to load by
> > > decreasing update frequency (so you don't exceed available
> > > bandwidth). When that happens in a game like this, moving
> > > entities appear to blink in and out of existence as the client
> > > and server get out of synch.
> > >
> > > --
> > > John H. Kim
> > > kim@...
